isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - BUS BODY CONSTRUCTION - TOUCH UP PROCEDURE FOR NATIONAL SCHOOL BUS YELLOW URETHANE (KAY0015/CT0066)

svcproc.title: TOUCH UP PROCEDURE FOR NATIONAL SCHOOL BUS YELLOW URETHANE (KAY0015/CT0066)

step1.para: All dirt, grease, oils, sealant or any contaminants must be removed. Surface should be washed. Solvent wash is recommended.
Surface area must be scuff sanded with fine finishing grade sandpaper until gloss is removed. On final sanding operation, 400 grit or finer sandpaper is recommended.
Surface area must be clean of all sanding dust and other particulates. Tack cloth wipe of area is recommended.

svcsubproc.title: Metal Preparation and Prime
svcsubproc.para: All bare metal areas are to be treated/conditioned and then primed. Use a metal treatment/conditioner. Apply a coat of good quality, two-component epoxy primer before applying topcoat. Primer should be an automotive grade.

svcsubproc.title: Topcoat
svcsubproc.para: KAY0015/CT0066 needs to be mixed at a ratio of four parts paint (KAY0015) to one part catalyst (CTC00660) by volume.
Products are to be mixed thoroughly.
Paint can be reduced with a maximum of 2.5 ounces BCA solvent per quart. Add the BCA solvent to the KAY0015 part before mixing with the CTC0066.
This product has a "pot life" of fifteen minutes at 77°F after being mixed together. Product should be used within this time.
Product, when mixed properly, will "cure to tape" in two hours with maximum hardness being achieved in three to five days with NO external heat source.
